data.title: Quick Open "ext" and "ext install" not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

These commands just hang and never complete. We probably want to remove "ext" now that we have the Extension View but we should keep "ext install blah" working since there is a lot of external documentation that calls out using Quick Open "ext install blah" to install an extension.

The Marketplace also calls out "ext install" and we need to leave this up for at least a couple of VS Code releases for people who aren't yet on the June release.

data.title: @SkiftCreative cannot start Code because dormant instance running in background
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  1.3.0-insider
- OS Version:
  OSX, El Capitan (10.11.5)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start VS Code from the terminal
2. let it fail

I have been using code without much issue. But today I tried to start it (with no other instances already going) from the terminal, and I get this error:

```
> code --verbose
(1:41:04 PM) Sending env to running instance...
(1:41:04 PM) Sent env to running instance. Terminating...
```

The launch icon short for a few seconds, then disappears. I tried launching by clicking the `.app` launcher as well and still crashes. 

Trying to disable extensions as well doesn't seem to help. 

```
> code --verbose --disable-extensions
(1:42:37 PM) Sending env to running instance...
(1:42:37 PM) Sent env to running instance. Terminating...
```

here is the extensions I have installed:

```
EditorConfig.EditorConfig
HvyIndustries.crane
Kasik96.format-indent
PeterJausovec.vscode-docker
TsumiNa.Seti-theme
Tyriar.sort-lines

nwallace.language-vscode-javascript-angular2

robinbentley.sass-indented
saviorisdead.RustyCode
shardulm94.trailing-spaces
smkamranqadri.vscode-material-design-lite-snippets

```

data.title: SetVariable doesn't trigger reevaluation of stale variables
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider, 2016-06-23

Assigning to a variable doesn't prompt a reevaluation of any variables that depend on it. Variables can be stale after setting a variable in languages such as C# (e.g. a property in the locals window), and watch expressions can be stale in all languages since they can be arbitrary expressions dependent on the changed variable.

data.title: Terminal has display bugs with julia console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider (de66522)
- OS Version: Win10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install [julia v0.4.6](http://julialang.org/downloads/)
2. Configure VS code terminal to use PowerShell
3. Start VS Code terminal, then start a julia instance in the terminal (I have an alias for `julia` in my PowerShell session, you might have to enter the full path)
4. Enter shell mode by typing `;`, then enter the following characters `dir /cmd` or something like that, then hit `Backspace` a couple of times. You might have to fiddle around a little, my repo was not 100%.

I then get a screen that looks like this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1036561/16347494/db4211b2-3a01-11e6-9ed9-17dcc64d9f55.png)
The prompt now is shown twice. Sometimes I also get the prompt moved to the right, jumping around etc. I have never seen that sort of behavior when I start julia in the normal windows command window, or anywhere else (Mintty etc.).

data.title: Proposal: Let users set the Height of sidebar areas
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest
- OS Version: Any

At the moment the sections can be collapsed, but there is no way to just hover over and set them to the desired size. Let's for example you want to have a large section for Variables, and a small one for callstack & breakpoints. At the moment there's no way to set these yourself, and if you want a section to be large you have to minimize all others.

Just thought it'd be nice for everyone to have more control over them, set them up to exactly what each person likes.

![screen shot 2016-06-24 at 10 54 30 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/16341260/3ae58a7a-39fa-11e6-892a-64c36947b27e.png)

data.title: files.trimTrailingWhitespace is inverted

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  I have the following settings: 

```
    "editor.renderWhitespace": true,
    "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": false,
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": false,
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
```
1.  Hit space a few times at the end of a line and wait a second. Your cursor will jump back to the last character (since it trims the whitespace on the autosave). 
2. However, if I set `files.trimTrailingWhitespace: true` then it does not trim the file. When I tell it trim it does not trim. When I tell it not to trim then it trims. 

Is this intended behavior? It feels opposite of what I would expect based on the setting name.

data.title: Visual Studio Code shouldn't hijack .config extension association
data.body:
After installing 'Visual Studio Code' .config files started to be associated with VSCode.
I am not sure that VSCode is a better editor for config files than Visual Studio or Notepad++. So user should make a decision which program should be associated with each extension, in particular such multi-purpose as .config. Installation should associate with VSCode only new extensions, that not used by anyone else.

And now in file explorer for files with .config extension type is shown as 'Visual Studio Code'.  It doesn't make any sense.
Please fix the installation ASAP.

It's a second bug with VSCode type associations that I noticed 
[Installation of vscode-powershell replaced File Explorer right-click menus for .ps1 files ](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6387) 
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:Install VSCode

data.title: Feature Request - Project-level extensions and snippets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version: all

We have a custom set of snippets written per-project and would like to include them in the project repo, like our launch.json, tasks.json. Right now we just include the json file and the dev has to copy+paste it into his user snippets, but the snippets are particular to a project, not to all projects.

Also it would be great to have a way to define what extensions a developer should have installed to work on the project. We use several code quality and styling plugins to enforce our custom rules and it would be nice if there was a project definition file to suggest installation of the extensions we define.

data.title: js validation doesn't work ?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I open a folder, then create a simple .js file with unvalid syntax but I have no error hightlighted.

Is there something to do to enable js validation errors displayed ?

In user settings, I have `javascript.validate.enable` set to true and it's not overwritten in workspace settings.

For example a file with this code doesn't display any error:

```
functin foo() {
    bar();
}
```

data.title: API Request: Control over history
data.body:
In the process of working on a [Vim plugin for VSCode](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim) I've run into a number of areas where I need a little bit of API help. Apologies if any of my suggestions already exist!

Vim's undo/redo history diverges from VSCode's almost immediately, since multiple changes in Vim can be considered a single undo step. This is very important just about everywhere in Vim, and is especially important in things like macros which combine multiple actions into a single step.

data.title: API request: Tab-Complete event
data.body:
In the process of working on a [Vim plugin for VSCode](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim) I've run into a number of areas where I need a little bit of API help. Apologies if any of my suggestions already exist!

It would be _very_ useful for me to have some sort of way both to monitor when a tab-complete action is triggered (and in particular to retrieve the text that was completed). I need this for things like macros and the . command, which repeats what the user just did.

data.title: API request: Live Positions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In the process of working on a [Vim plugin for VSCode](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim) I've run into a number of areas where I need a little bit of API help. Apologies if any of my suggestions already exist!

Vim has the concept of marks, which are positions in the document that you can jump to from anywhere. They're like the Positions the API provides, but if you delete text from before the mark, the position of the mark will change. 

It seems highly likely that you guys have something like this internally, and I think it would be disappointing (and possibly difficult) to roll my own. Help?
